workflowInfo.workflowDescription: This workflow can be used to define a new GDG Base.

variable.name: gdg-name
variable.label: Please enter the GDG name
variable.abstract: This is the name of the new GDG base file
variable.description: This is the name of the new GDG base file

variable.name: gdg-empty
variable.label: Please select the EMPTY option
variable.abstract: Select if all generations should be uncatalog after the limit is reached.
variable.description: EMPTY will uncatalog all generations after limit is reached. NOEMPTY will uncatalog the least recent only.

variable.name: gdg-limit
variable.label: Please enter the GDG Limit
variable.abstract: This is the limit of GDG files that will be created.
variable.description: When the limit is reached, the oldest DSN in GDG will be overwritten

variable.name: gdg-scratch
variable.label: Please select the SCRATCH option
variable.abstract: Select if generation is physically deleted after uncatalog.
variable.description: SCRATCH will delete after uncatalog. NOSCRATCH will not.

step.name: GDG-Definition
step.title: Define GDG Base
step.description: This step will define a new GDG.
step.instructions: This step will define GDG base: $gdg-name. This step can be used interactively or be triggered from a service userID.
